title: What's the point of a ranked system in this game?
body:
When your Diamond players play the same as silver players, and your grandmaster players run it down just as much as bronzes ask yourself the question.

Literally, have any of you'll who have supposedly 'escaped' low elo ever felt like you were rewarded for doing so? Is the matchmaking any better? Are your teamamtes any wiser? Or are you still playing the same shithole of a game which you'll have always aspired to climb out of?

I didn't have an argument lol, but I feel like it kind of makes sense that there are many people in gold? Just because I don't think there are really many new players in league, and if the playerbase is mainly people who have been playing for awhile, then you would think after years of playing, they could at least make it to Gold. 

I agree though, even as I've been trying to climb, no matter what rank, the same brand of stupid can be found.

I think the point of the ranked system is to get a comparison of your average skill level vs the average skill level of the other people who play ranked.

Anyone who doesn't think there is a noticeable difference in skill between the divisions is delusional.
Even a small a jump as Bronze to Gold is massive. Playing in bronze as a gold player is a hilariously noticeable dip in average skill.

You are still playing against humans however, so expecting PEOPLE to be different is going to lead to disappointment. Someone's game skill has no real correlation to whether or not that person is an immature prick who will run it down mid when someone points out a mistake, or just rage AFK if a teammate dies too early.

There are huge differences in skill. When the average elo of my games are ranked at p1-d5 it feels like a completely different game compared to averages p3-p2. People are dodging things, kiting better, wave managing, rotating and ramping up the game's tempo harder compared to like gold/silver. It's on both teams not just my own. If you really want to babyrage about your loss streak just quit rank then.

I love this game but Riot needs to take a step back and look at matchmaking/ranked system.  I just made a post on this yesterday that made its way to the top of the gameplay boards.  Its f'ing broken for some players.  Forget about micro-patches, reworked champs that only matter in pro play, and crap item balances of 1-2 ap/ad that don't matter.  Figure out a way to improve the matching/ranked system.   Its just not as fun as it used to be for the average player.  I truly fear for the future.
There is this saying I've heard related to LoL:  "If everyone is good, than no one is".

That would be true if Riot didn't try so hard to dumb the game down. The new champion and reworks make is so that you can miss everything and still get kills.

The only good player in this day and age is one who doesn't either run it down or go afk.

This is such an underrated comment.. Every new champion and champion rework is so overloaded in their kit.. Miss half your stuff, still get rewarded for a kill. There isn't any skill in that.. 

That being said, and I know I'm going to be down voted for this... That makes Akali one of the most balanced champs in the game. She is one of the few champs and assassins that need to hit everything perfectly if she wants to do her job. (yes I know it sucks getting blown up by a fed akali, but ANY champ fed can do that so lets stop the stupid hyperbole arguments). She is vulnerable if she uses them to clear lanes, or help cs, and she's melee allowing exchanges in damage in lane to happen while she's trying to cs. It actually takes some skill to work around all that and use her effectively.

Meanwhile Zed for example (even with his nerfs), only has to land less than half hsi stuff to blow you up. His shadow allows him to farm extremely safely while behind, something which akali cannot do very safely (She can use her shroud, but she's still very susceptible to skillshot damage, and aoe's), and he's easy to get back into the game with because all the safety, utility, and damage steroids he gets. 

Even talon again, point and click mass damage assassin. 

Of course these are assassins, but even mages, and bruisers are the same thing now. Overloaded kits, with ridiculous damage. Tankyness, and defense has been almost neutered and removed completely in this game, except on champs that rely on insane attack damage/speed with lifesteal to tank through damage.

This is a matter of relativity, when you start playing you see that your teammates are playing badly, but you miss a lot of their mistakes. The more you climb, the less mistake your teammates and opponents do, but the more you know about the game and you can spot more mistakes.

So it feels like whatever your elo, you see the same amount of stupid mistakes. 

If you ever started a new account or climbed an account from bronze when your real elo is actually gold/plat+ you'll see that the reality is you will CRUSH your way out of the  lower leagues. Exploiting obvious and ridiculous mistakes from your opponents.

Top getting constantly ganked, no help from jungler? Getting dove? Obviously the top lane sucks, gg, mass report as troll and run it down mid... 

That happens at every elo WAAAAAAY too often.. 

The mentality of the players to tilt on the smallest stuff, refuse to help teammates, and trash each other is what destroys this game, especially ranked, and yes, that happens constantly at every elo.

What's the point when the amount of trolls are so abundant and smurfing is allowed?  Smurfing is the anti-thesis to the entire ranked system.  Not to mention the worst match making of any game I can recall, giving out EA quality match making in most cases.

I wish to say that while players are at different levels, they will mostly play the same. After all, mistakes are inevitable. From what I see from the rank system is consistency. Yes, a grandmaster player will be better than bronze, but they will overall do similar mistakes the bronze player does.

The rank system is a joke in general. The main point is to have you grind the game. Sure, you can improve on the game and find fun in it. Suspecting a very competitive experience? Likely not.
